title: Work
pros: Good pay and good people good environment
cons: No cons everything great loved working gete

title: Dishonest Leadership, Toxic Culture – Beware
pros: Free brunches at the end of the month.
cons: This company has a serious transparency problem — both internally and externally. Many honest, critical reviews on this site have mysteriously disappeared over time, which is why you’re likely not seeing the full picture. If you’re reading this, there’s a good chance this review will also be deleted, just like the others that dared to speak the truth. The work culture at WhiteStone REIT is toxic, fear-driven, and unsustainable. The constant pressure, hostility, and lack of support took a real toll on my health — so much so that I ended up in the hospital for 10 days. No job should ever push an employee to that point, yet leadership here shows no concern for employee well-being. The Chief People Officer in particular operates with alarming dishonesty. After my departure, she attempted to twist facts and submit misleading information to block my unemployment benefits. Thankfully, the truth came out and I was awarded benefits, but no one should have to go through such a vindictive process after already enduring a damaging workplace. The company’s downward spiral is not just internal. Their stock has been in sharp decline since the beginning of the year, reflecting the poor decisions and lack of effective leadership at the top. High turnover, low morale, and retaliation against those who speak up are the norm. If you value your health, career, and integrity, avoid WhiteStone REIT. The truth is hidden behind carefully curated PR and removed reviews — but the problems are very real.

title: Poor Culture and Lack of Support
pros: Some of the benefits are decent.
cons: My experience at Whitestone REIT was unfortunately very negative. The work environment felt disorganized and unsupportive, and communication from leadership was often unclear. Employee development and recognition were minimal, which made it difficult to feel valued or motivated. The culture leaned more toward stress and frustration than collaboration, and opportunities for growth were limited. While the company may be a fit for some, in my opinion there are healthier and more supportive workplaces out there.

title: Great Outlook
pros: CSuite genuinely cares about their employees. They go above and beyond to try to accommodate everyone, no matter the title or rank. Bad reviews prior to the CEO change in 2022 may have some validity. Post leadership change, they are from bad apples that have benefited for too long doing below the bare minimum. Those that continue to criticize the COO or the company in general, need to take a step back and realize that accountability fosters professionalism and more efficiency. The problem isn’t the COO or Whitestone, it’s you. Instead of taking everything personally and retaliating with petty reviews, look at ways of improving your skills and work ethic and lessen your ego. I have found a work family here and look forward to coming to the office. Never have felt this way about a job before.
cons: There’s a few bad apples left that management still sees potential in. They’re stuck in their old ways and negatively affect those who have to work with them. Company can benefit from continuing basic computer skills training. They outsource their IT to a horrible vendor.

title: Supportive team environment
pros: My co-workers are the best. They've made me feel welcome and a part of the team from the beginning. We work hard, but also take time to play with monthly celebrations.
cons: I cannot think of any.

title: Three years down and I’m still here.
pros: Learning opportunities that provide you with influential real estate experience- the company is willing to invest in you. Not to mention the benefits are sweet too: healthcare, PTO, 401K… all that good jazz.
cons: No organic fruit in communal kitchen. Thick skin is required.

title: Enjoyable experience thus far.
pros: Great team of employees. Lots of future opportunity if you are diligent and loyal. Management change has cultivated a more positive working environment.
cons: Low starting pay. Hard work.

pros: if you are desperate it's a pay check.
cons: Horrible culture and company with terrible people skills. Crappy properties with struggling tenants.

title: Work on work culture
pros: Health Perks, Team Bonding Events, Coffee/Snacks. I learned a lot about property management. I had some great memories with specific teammates who were helpful and validating.
cons: If you want a job that talks you down and makes you feel like everything you do is never enough, then join Whitestone. They do not know the first thing about treating hard working employees. Full of criticism, and no positive reinforcements, they expect you to take on more than the job entails, but don't show gratitude for taking on additional roles (just more criticism). The job in property management itself can already be challenging enough, but the toxic work environment makes things worse.

title: Warning don't interview
pros: They pay for travel expenses, training, and professional organizations generously. The Phoenix office seems to be well run and a great place to work. Their management is solid. Non of the
cons: seem to apply to the Phoenix office.

title: It is not for Everyone
pros: I have seen this company evolve over time for many years. I can tell you that there have been some major improvements that have been an up hill battle to implement. Is it for everyone, No it is not. Like many places, not everyone is a good fit. There is room for improvement and the teams that are making those improvements are busting the humps to make those changes happen. One thing that I will say, is that this place will teach you a lot about real estate.
cons: This place is not for everyone. It is a challenge but if you are up for then it can be rewarding. If you are not then you will fail here.

title: Professional
pros: When people first start working with WSR they believe the hype: it's a fun, professional, exciting new atmosphere, where you can grow, and learn more about the real estate business. Honestly, they have been known to take back promotions initially promised, or just plainly disregard employees with the potential to grow/learn other roles with the company.
cons: Stop allowing favoritism dictate how you promote certain employees; Allow loyalty to be earned and not given because certain employees snitch and or lie on employees; have some Dignity on how you address matters that mean something to your current/future employees. Remember how you treat people in the past and in the future will have a direct reflection on your business.

title: Great Company with Really Great People
pros: Through the year and a half I have been at Whitestone, I have to say that the people there have truly made it a worthwhile experience. Not every company gets to have associates as great as the ones at WSR, and for that I'm truly thankful. They also genuinely care for all the employees, make sure that they're well taken care of. Everyone at this company is in really good hands with really good leadership. I would highly recommend working at a company like Whitestone with people as awesome as the ones we have!
cons: Aside from the workload on some days, I honestly can't really think of any disadvantages of working for a company as great as Whitestone.

title: Upper Mgmt Doesn't Get It
pros: Good co-workers Decent Salary Good opp to add diversity to your resume
cons: Upper management doesn't trust their employees Over work / over load their employees - no departmental support Doesn't understand their business overall Doesn't care about their lease holders Not in line with industry salaries based on what positions are expected to do Upper management is too busy patting themselves on their own back to recognize what the employees are accomplishing

title: No trust. Nepotism. Toxic
pros: Co-workers. But they leave so its not very good. Everyone is a stock holder. My $50 worth of stock allowed me to get an extra $1.75 a month in dividends.
cons: Upper management is full of nepotism and they do not hide their favoritism. HR is powerless to do anything real except plan the next health event. One executive I worked for makes you repeat your work even though they have not reviewed it. I on more than 1 occasion made reports for them and was told to make it better with no real direction. I just handed the same report back 2 days later and got a "that's more like it". Cameras are EVERYWHERE in the office so the CEO can keep tabs on employees.

title: Great company for someone who is looking to grow! Personally and professionally
pros: The Austin office has an incredibly friendly office culture and you become part of the Whitestone family. There are always learning opportunities and potential growth within the company. They own and manage their own properties so you know they genuinely care about maintaining their properties.
cons: Weak presence in real estate market but even better opportunity to get out there and network! Salaries are not as high as other larger companies, but always willing to work with you!

title: An evolving company
pros: The people there are great. They are helpful and provide tons of help and information. Their interview and hiring process was smooth and completed in a timely manner. The manager I worked under provided clear explanations for why things are done a certain way.
cons: They could provide more holidays. Less work load. More department cross training so that department roles and how they impact each other are more defined.

title: Needed a job so it worked while it lasted
pros: Non-Management people are great to work with, friendly and warm, they always went above and beyond to satisfy management.
cons: Company doesn't respect its employees or treat them well, just as pawns, turnover rate is high

title: New Challenge
pros: The company is very challenging, co-workers are very helpful and extremely nice, office is in a central location close to restaurants, freeway, beltway, etc...
cons: Since company is growing at such a fast pace the workloads do seems to come in bucket loads, everyone seems to be overwhelmed with their duties. Many work long hours and feel unappreciated or perhaps even a little discouraged.

title: Do Not Even Think About Working Here
pros: I have heard that the Phoenix office has a better working environment than Houston. It does provide a paycheck and insurance.
cons: Been at the Houston office for more than a year now. What a hostile working environment. Second person in charge is making the work place here almost impossible to handle. Salaries are at the bottom range at best. High turnover rate. Quality employees just leave.

title: Run Away!
pros: Snack bar and free coffee There are literally no other benefits.
cons: HR is horrible. You cannot trust them with anything. Everyone talks and you can tell they prefer to backup the CEO/upper management then the workers themselves! The whole workplace is completely unprofessional. Company obviously doesn't trust their employees. There are cameras everywhere. Leadership is terrible. Overall it is a VERY toxic work environment. I have never left a job quicker than this one.

title: Don't waste your energy
pros: Has good intentions and a few great key employees.
cons: Outdated systems, high turnover rate in every department, property managers are required to submit multiple weekly reorts that are repetitive in information and time consuming, PM department has a lot of envy and there is a lot of snitching on each other behind closed doors. Very money driven and works in a lot of grey areas to produce numbers because they are a public traded company, ethics are questionable

title: Think Twice
pros: Snack and Coffee Bar. Decent company benefits.
cons: This company is hemorrhaging and upper management cant figure out why or doesn't care. Be careful if you talk to HR NOTHING is confidential. The work loads do not equal pay, you basically work hard for nothing, there is no appreciation whatsoever at this place. Everyone works in a fish bowl environment. Camera's are everywhere they trust no one.

title: Growth Opportunity
pros: Whitestone is not for everyone, it's a work environment that encourages high productivity and a collaborative team environment. The company continues to evolve through the years. I like the challenge and the opportunity to learn and grow is offered to those that want it.
cons: Continue to drive changes at all level

title: This Little Piece of Chaos is NOT for Everyone
pros: Management is very fair regarding personal issues. Most of the team members were very friendly and professional while I was there.
cons: Some days could be quite chaotic. Middle management can often be clueless and will have a different vision than the higher-ups. Different visions mean a lot of going back and reworking already completed or nearly completed work.

title: No Structure
pros: You can pretty much do whatever you want, because there are no standards no one is held accountable so it is pretty hard to get fired. Just show up and you are doing better than most.
cons: Same as the Pro, if you are an over-achiever then you will sucked dry while you compensate for those around you.

title: Really bad Sr Management
pros: The employees who are trying hard to do the right thing
cons: It is time for the Board of Directors to do the right thing and allow this Publuc Company to be run like one. Currently it is being run (to quote the man with the dog) "with a Wall Street ATM" ..........thiis needs to STOP! The potential is enormous if the nepotism was removed and a strong responsible Management team was in place. How many more Vice Presidents will you lose before you wake up.

title: Culture Changed on 1/18/2022
pros: The CEO change on 1/18/2022 fixed a ton of issues commented on in prior posts. The company now has a cohesive, fun team and steady supportive management. The team is excellent at getting things done and allowing individuals to succeed.
cons: Small company with ~90 people means sometimes you don't have the same breadth of opportunity versus a larger corporation.

title: Proceed with CAUTION!
pros: A paycheck for the time being, health insurance
cons: Upper management, CEO & CEO wife, didn't hold to commission payouts like promised

title: Run the other direction
pros: A few quality workers, unfortunately they are over looked.
cons: Below market pay, no training unless you call rolling your sleeves up and figuring out yourself. No support from upper management, just excuses of I am really busy, no wonder they have a high turn over and placement agencies that don't like to work with them.

title: building engineer
pros: Good people in company if given a chance to succeed
cons: Hard to advanve within the company . Not organized

title: Good Co-Workers Broken System
pros: There were several smart, diverse and passion driven coworkers at Whitestone.
cons: No training and employee turnover

title: Excellent Company and Culture
pros: The leadership team is very supportive. The office culture is great and all team members work well together.
cons: I have no cons to list.

title: Mom and Pop Shop
pros: great and friendly non-management people. On the road to creating good company culture.
cons: The benefits are terrible and so is the HR department. Management is highly inconsiderate of non-management employees. There are many long drawn out meetings, and there is absolutely no work life balance.

title: Leasing Agent
pros: Good learning experience right out of college.
cons: Pay is bad...low commissions.

title: LOVE MY JOB
pros: Great coworkers. A company that cares. Great senior management & Boss. Great HR department.
cons: Can't think of any cons

title: Great Company To Work For
pros: Good company to work for
cons: Nothing I can think of

title: Great Company
pros: Employees are sweet and helpfull
cons: Processes need improvement. Increase tech uses.

title: Great!
pros: Great culture... Good benefits... Learn a lot...
cons: Limit as to how far you can grow within the company.

title: WHITESTONE REIT ROCKS!
pros: Very family oriented and loving company
cons: N/A-I have nothing negative to say

title: Very good
pros: Benefits are very good. Health insurance
cons: Long hours. No room for growth

title: Enjoy working here
pros: Ability to make a difference
cons: Corporate culture sometimes gets old

title: Awful
pros: The only thing that was okay about working here were the benefits.
cons: You'll be overworked and not compensated fairly. I had to get therapy after this job since it took a significant toll on my mental health.

title: General overview
pros: This is a way to gain career entry into the REIT industry.
cons: HIgh turnover rate. General distrust of senior management. Minimal benefits, cost-cutting efforts abound.

title: Toxic
pros: Good coworkers and benefits. That is it
cons: Toxic and disrespectful culture coming from top management. Long work hours.

title: Terrible place to work.
pros: They provide a low salary
cons: Too many to even list

title: Paranoid work environment
pros: Houston office on Westheimer near Beltway 8 in Westchase.
cons: Long working hours, low compensation.
